alert.note: Alert for Garfield (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 17 at 3:27PM MDT until August 17 at 4:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CENTRAL GARFIELD COUNTY... At 327 PM MDT, A flood wave has reached the Escalante River Gauge near Escalante and the Escalante River has risen by 2.5 feet. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen in the upper headwaters of Birch Creek and North Creek. Flash flooding is already occurring with the flash flood wave expected to move into Upper Escalante River Canyon. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Escalante. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
